content.rendered:
Talk to a healthcare specialist online.

Connect with Canadian medical specialists and allied health professionals right from your smartphone, tablet, or computer.

Online consultations are available on demand within 72 hours or by appointment, depending on the specialty.

Get started now

See a specialist for your unique concerns.

Dermatology

Dermatologists specialize in skin, hair, nail, and mucous membrane disorders from head to toe.

Read more
Mole Mapping

Full-body scan to screen for moles, lesions, and skin cancer. Appointments require an in-person visit to our dermatologist’s clinic.

Read more
Independent COVID-19 Testing

If you’re about to travel internationally, get a COVID-19 test at select clinics.

Read more
Weight Management

A personalized consultation with a weight management specialist can give you the support and tools you need to help you manage your weight.

Read more
Psychotherapy

Take care of your mental health. Psychotherapists can help you cope and manage stress, anxiety, depression and more.

Read more
Mental Health Physician

Mental health physicians are general practitioners who diagnose and manage specific mental health conditions and can provide prescription medication.

Read more
Naturopathy

Naturopathic doctors can help improve your overall well-being with holistic treatment plans.

Read more
Endocrinology

Endocrinologists help manage hormonal imbalances and treat issues that can arise from hormone problems.

Read more
Caregiver Coaching

If you’re a family caregiver or are dealing with a health issue, you don’t need to navigate your journey alone.

Read more
Addiction Management

Addiction is a complex condition that can have a serious impact on your life. An addiction management specialist can help you overcome your unique challenges.

Read more
Pediatrics

Feeding issues, behavioural issues, growing pains, and more. Kids are tricky and pediatricians are trained to identify and treat their unique issues.

Read more
Psychiatry

Mental illness can affect all areas of your life. Psychiatrists can diagnose you and prescribe medications that will help you feel like yourself again.

Read more
Speech Therapy

Certified speech-language pathologists work with individuals who are experiencing communication challenges through speech or writing.

Read more
Respirology

Lung conditions like chronic cough, COPD and asthma are difficult to manage on your own. A respirologist can help.

Read more
Diet and Nutrition

Proper nutrition is the key to a healthy body. Speak to a registered dietitian to design a food plan that fits your health needs today.

Read more
General Health Assessment

Schedule a general health assessment with a physician or nurse practitioner for a comprehensive look at your health.

Read more
Functional Medicine

Looking for more than a checkup? Take a holistic approach to your health by speaking with a functional medicine expert.

Read more
Allergy & Immunology

Allergists are specially trained to treat allergies in children and adults. You can be allergic to specific substances, or have recurring seasonal allergies.

Read more
Sleep Therapy

Sleep is a learned skill. Sleep therapists can help you get the rest you need.

Read more
Life Coaching

Need guidance in your life? A life coach can help. From goal setting to overcoming challenges, you can go a long way by talking with an expert.

Read more
Cognitive Assessment

Test your brain function with a cognitive assessment. Evaluate 25 key cognitive skills, including attention, communication, and memory.

Read more
Lactation & Breastfeeding

Breastfeeding can be hard. Bad latches, tongue ties, low supply – lactation consultants can help you fix most breastfeeding issues.

Read more
Diabetes Counselling

A diabetes diagnosis comes with many lifestyle changes. A diabetes nurse educator can help you manage the transition.

Read more
Oncology Navigation

Cancer is complicated. Sometimes you need a second opinion and help navigating the system. Speaking with an oncologist can help.

Read more
Dermatology

Dermatologists specialize in skin, hair, nail, and mucous membrane disorders from head to toe.

Read more
Mole Mapping

Full-body scan to screen for moles, lesions, and skin cancer. Appointments require an in-person visit to our dermatologist’s clinic.

Read more
Independent COVID-19 Testing

If you’re about to travel internationally, get a COVID-19 test at select Toronto clinics.

Read more
Pediatrics

Feeding issues, behavioural issues, growing pains, and more. Kids are tricky and pediatricians are trained to identify and treat their unique issues.

Read more
Psychiatry

Mental illness can affect all areas of your life. Psychiatrists can diagnose you and prescribe medications that will help you feel like yourself again.

Read more
Psychotherapy

Take care of your mental health. Psychotherapists can help you cope and manage stress, anxiety, depression and more.

Read more
Naturopathy

Naturopathic doctors can help improve your overall well-being with holistic treatment plans.

Read more
Endocrinology

Endocrinologists help manage hormonal imbalances and any issues that can arise when hormones are out of whack.

Read more
Respirology

Lung conditions like chronic cough, COPD and asthma are difficult to manage on your own. A respirologist can help.

Read more
Diet and Nutrition

Proper nutrition is the key to a healthy body. Speak to a Registered Dietitian to design a food plan that fits your health needs today.

Read more
Functional Medicine

Looking for more than a checkup? Take a holistic approach to your health by speaking with a functional medicine expert.

Read more
Allergy & Immunology

Allergists are specially trained to treat allergies in children and adults. You can be allergic to specific substances, or have recurring seasonal allergies.

Read more
Sleep Therapy

Sleep is a learned skill. Sleep therapists can help you get the rest you need.

Read more
Life Coaching

Need guidance in your life? A life coach can help. From goal setting to overcoming challenges, you can go a long way by talking with an expert.

Read more
Cognitive Assessment

Test your brain function with a cognitive assessment. Evaluate 25 key cognitive skills, including attention, communication, and memory.

Read more
Lactation & Breastfeeding

Breastfeeding can be hard. Bad latches, tongue ties, low supply – lactation consultants can help you fix most breastfeeding issues.

Read more
Diabetes Counselling

A diabetes diagnosis comes with many lifestyle changes. A diabetes nurse educator can help you manage the transition.

Read more
Oncology Navigation

Cancer is complicated. Sometimes you need a second opinion and help navigating the system. Speaking with an oncologist can help.

Read more
Hemorrhoid Surgery Consultation

Hemorrhoids are extremely common. Review your options with a hemorrhoids expert and surgeon in less time than it takes to book an appointment.

Read more
Gallbladder Surgery Consultation

Contemplating gallbladder surgery? Get an online consultation with a gallbladder expert and surgeon in 24 hours or less.

Read more

How to connect with a specialist on Maple.

Specialty What type of provider would you like to see?
  • Endocrinologist
  • Psychiatrist
  • Dermatologist
  • Psychotherapist
  • Pediatrician
  • Respirologist

First, select a specialist

Log in to Maple and click the “Get care” button. You’ll be prompted to select a GP or specialist. Depending on the specialist you’ve chosen, you’ll be taken through a short intake form, including when you’d like to see the specialist and your symptoms.

The app then uses your location to match you with a licensed specialist. Depending on the specialty, you can either book an appointment or request to have a consultation as soon as possible – if so, you’ll hear back from the specialist within 12-72 hours based on the service.

Get started

Next, you’ll hear from the specialist

Once the specialist reviews your request, they’ll determine whether they can help you on Maple. If they’re able to help, your visit will start, either right away or at the scheduled time.

If they cannot help, your visit won’t start and you won’t be charged. The practitioner will let you know if you need to seek in person care, or visit a family practice or walk-in clinic instead.

Get started
  • Hi Olivia, here’s the treatment I’m recommending for you:

    Dr. Gibbons

  • Diagnosis for Olivia: Acne
  • Dr. Gibbons has written you
    a prescription: Retin-A 0.1% one nightly for 60 days Accept prescription Decline

Start your visit

You can speak with the specialist through live chat, audio, or video depending on the specialty.

Many benefit programs cover healthcare consultation fees, so check with your benefits provider to see if you’re covered. Your practitioner’s license number will always be on your Maple receipt.

If you see a medical specialist on Maple, they have the ability to diagnose and provide treatment recommendations. You’ll receive any prescriptions or treatment plans digitally in the Maple app. Prescriptions are automatically faxed to the pharmacy of your choice. We also offer free delivery to your address.

Note: Maple is not a pharmaceutical manufacturer, nor are we an online pharmacy.

Get started
Looking for a general practitioner?

Skip the waiting room. See a licensed doctor in minutes, any time 24/7.

Learn more

Get started today.

Maple revolves around your needs and schedule. Start enjoying on-demand healthcare that fits your life.

Get started
